column4: Can I please get some troublehooting tips for problems setting acl rules for a symlink? Ubuntu Server 10.04 LTS. Keep getting "Permission denied": https://gist.github.com/1427103
you're actually trying to set acl rules on the symlink's target, correct?
Good catch. Yes. The target.
pastebin the output of « mount »
why are you setting mask like that?
https://gist.github.com/1427103#file_mount.md
because . . . http://xdissent.com/2010/05/04/github-clone-with-redmine/#redmine-the-key-master
what's the output of « getfacl whatever_that_file_is » now?
getfacl output: https://gist.github.com/1427103#file_getfacl_output.md
you're on ubuntu?
Ubuntu Server 10.04 LTS.
check parents all the way up to / are accessible to redmine.  i.e. can redmine get to /, /opt, /opt/gitosis
I'm not totally sure what it's supposed to look like: https://gist.github.com/1427103#file_ls__la_output.md
it will be easier to read if you do ls -lad :)
I'm guessing the point is to have git own all the git stuff, and only allow redmine to use the private key to connect to git repositories.
but yes I see the problem is /opt/gitosis/, you need to let redmine execute that
https://gist.github.com/1427103#file_ls__lad_output.md
yep, did you see my last?
I'm checking that right now.
https://gist.github.com/1427103#file_chmod_opt_gitosis.md --> Thanks. I'm sure that `chmod 777` ain't the best solution. What would you recommend?
just use ACLs like you did on /opt/gitosis/.ssh
drrr. Thanks. You got lightningy troubleshooting skill!
That fixed my prob. I can create repos in Redmine. Nice.
